page.title: 05EDUCATION IN SHELDON
page.content: THE TINY ONE ROOMED SCHOOL CLOSED IN 1934 AS THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN HAS DECREASED.IN 1922 THERE WERE 25 OF SCHOOL AGE,THIS YEAR THERE ARE 14. INFANTS AND JUNIORS GO BY TAXI TO THE SCHOOL IN ASHFORD, 2 MILES AWAY.THIS YEAR THERE ARE ONLY 3 PRIMARY AGE CHILDREN.SECONDARY SCHOOL CHILDREN GO BY BUS TO LADY MANNERS COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL IN BAKEWELL, 3 MILES AWAY.THE BUS SERVICE HAS ONLY BEEN AVAILABLE FOR 2 YEARS.BEFORE THEN CHILDREN HAD TO GET AS BEST THEY COULD, BY WALKING, CYCLING OR PARENTS CAR. FURTHER EDUCATION COURSES ARE AVAILABLE AT HIGH PEAK COLLEGE OF FURTHER EDUCATION NEAR BUXTON OR COLLEGES AT CHESTERFIELD.NURSERY EDUCATION IS AVAILABLE AT THE NEARBY VILLAGE OF FLAGG.AS THERE ARE NO OTHER NURSERY SCHOOLS IN THE AREA CHILDREN COME FROM MILES AROUND.
